result.execSummary:
The defendant Sylvia K Roy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution of $150 to Pawn America- Madison and to pay any restitution the Court determines at the forthcoming restitution hearing. 
--to pay the 10% restitution processing fee

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment  at the disscretion of the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as directed by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as directed by the Agent . The Court prohibits Ms. Roy from engaging in employment that requires her to work with the elderly or otherwise vulnerable adults.
--No contact with PLM, with the exeption to write an apology letter with the approval of the Agent and the victim
--to comply with DNA sample to DOC or designee upon demand

Arresting Agency: JCSD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Scheduling notice

Case called at 10:32am[MO]
Defendant Sylvia K Roy in court with Attorney Jennifer Lynn Weber. ADA Monica Hall  appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated in part and given in part; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.
The Court indicates that is the State determines that the $500 cocktail ring belonged to Ms. Roy, then this ring(currently being held as evidence) is to be returned to Pawn America, and the Court will not include the $500 value in the restitution order. The Court indicates that by not having Ms. Roy not pay restitution to Pawn America for all of the pawned items(including the items that were lawfully Ms. Roy's), the Court would be undoing a legal transaction. 
The Court recieves the Stipulation of the parties the wedding ring set issue remains unaddressed in the parties plea agreement. It is not being read in at this time. 

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment at the disscretion of the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as directed by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as directed by the Agent. The Court prohibits Ms. Roy from engaging in employment that requires her to work with the elderly or otherwise vulnerable adults.
--No contact with PLM, with the exeption to write an apology letter with the approval of the Agent and the victim
--to comply with DNA sample to DOC or designee upon demand
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--to pay restitution of $150 to Pawn America- Madison and to pay any restitution the Court determines at the forthcoming restitution hearing. 
--to pay the 10% restitution processing fee


Days credit for time already served:  1  day
Contact prohibition violation warnings/penalties given
Felony firearm/ voting prohibition warnings given 
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling of further Restitution Hearing. 
recess: 10:50am

NEXT: Further Restitution Hearing(allow 1/2 hour): 3/26/15 at 1:30pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 13, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Scheduling Notice

[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Sylvia K Roy in court with attorney Jennifer Lynn Weber.  Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  

Ms. Roy waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Court confirms address on file is accurate for Ms. Roy & reminds her that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 8:54 am

[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Sylvia K Roy in court with attorney Jennifer Lynn Weber.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case called at 1:22 pm 
Defendant Sylvia K Roy in custody, in court with Attorney Yelena Zarwell from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD appears for bond purposes only). ADA Theresa Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the Defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause.
Attorney Zarwell adds N. to the defendant's address.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $2,500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No direct or indirect contact with P.L.M. (DOB: 6/22/1931)
-No presence at the residence of the victim N1141 Lake Dr in the Town of Sumner or at any pawn shop

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given

Recess: 1:32 pm
